intro: Aloe fragilis, commonly known as the brittle aloe, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It features rosettes of narrow, gray-green leaves that are covered in fine white teeth along the edges. The plant produces yellow flowers on tall, branched inflorescences during the summer months. It is adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water once established. Aloe fragilis is valued for its ornamental appeal and has some traditional medicinal uses.
